Nostradamus C4Q55

← Back to Search

Old French from 1568

Quand la corneille sur tout de brique ioincte, [Quant] [tour]

Durant sept heures ne fera que crier:

Mort presagee de sang statue taincte,

Tyran meurtri, aux Dieux peuple prier.

Modern English

When the crow perches on every brick tower,

For seven hours it will only shout,

A death foretelling a statue of blood,

The wounded tyrant will pray to the people's gods.

Interpretation

A crow's ominous presence on towers for seven hours signals an impending blood‑stained death. A tyrant, already wounded, will beg the populace’s deities for aid—foretelling a doomed ruler’s desperate appeal before a violent end.
